Known for samba and bossa nova music
Christ the Redeemer statue overlooks Rio
Home to diverse wildlife and ecosystems
Brasília is the planned capital city
Iguazu Falls on border with Argentina
Cultural mix of indigenous, African, European
Yellow and green flag with blue globe

profiles.name: Egypt
clues: Ancient gods like Ra and Anubis
Valley of the Kings burial site
Crossroads between Africa and Middle East

Diverse climates from Arctic to tropical

Yangtze River is longest in Asia
Territorial disputes in East Asian sea

Once ruled largest empire in history

profiles.name: Amazon River
clues: Discharges approximately 209,000 cubic meters of water per second into the Atlantic Ocean
Contains over 3,000 recognized species of fish, more than the entire Atlantic Ocean
The meeting of waters phenomenon occurs where it joins the Rio Negro near Manaus
Reversed flow direction multiple times throughout geological history
Has no bridges spanning its main stretch despite being thousands of kilometers long
Second longest river in the world after the Nile
Flows through nine South American countries
Basin covers about 40% of the South American continent
Contains pink river dolphins unique to its waters
Source was officially identified in Peru in 1971
Named after female warriors from Greek mythology
Runs through the world's largest tropical rainforest
Provides about 20% of Earth's fresh water flowing into oceans
Surrounded by dense jungle on both banks
Major cities include Manaus and Belém
Used as primary transportation route in remote areas
Vital ecosystem for global climate regulation

profiles.name: Sahara Desert
clues: Expanded and contracted significantly during African humid periods over past 11,000 years
Contains the Eye of the Sahara, a mysterious circular geological formation
Temperature can fluctuate by 40 degrees Celsius between day and night
Once had megalakes and supported hippos and crocodiles until about 5,000 years ago
Sand dunes cover only about 25% of its total area
Roughly the same size as the United States or China
Name comes from Arabic word for desert
Contains several mountain ranges including the Tibesti Mountains
Dust storms can carry sand across the Atlantic to the Americas
Largest hot desert in the world
Extremely dry with very little rainfall
Ancient caravan trade routes crossed it
Expanding southward due to climate change

profiles.name: Grand Canyon
clues: Carved primarily by the Colorado River over approximately 5 to 6 million years
Exposes nearly 2 billion years of Earth's geological history
Contains rock layers that tell story from Precambrian to Paleozoic eras
Inner gorge reaches depths of over 1,800 meters below rim
First European to view it was Spanish explorer García López de Cárdenas in 1540
Designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1979
Approximately 277 miles long and up to 18 miles wide
Home to California condors, one of the rarest birds
North Rim and South Rim offer different perspectives and climates
One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World
Massive gorge with colorful layered rock formations
Popular destination for hiking and rafting
Carved by river over millions of years
Stunning views from multiple lookout points

profiles.name: Mount Kilimanjaro
clues: Has three volcanic cones named Kibo, Mawenzi, and Shira
Kibo's summit crater is approximately 2.5 kilometers wide
Last major eruption occurred approximately 360,000 years ago
Glaciers have lost more than 80% of their ice since early 1900s
Stands as a stratovolcano formed from volcanic activity over million years
Highest mountain in Africa at 5,895 meters
Located in Tanzania near the Kenyan border
Name possibly means "Mountain of Greatness" in Swahili
Five distinct ecological climate zones from base to summit
First successfully climbed by Hans Meyer and Ludwig Purtscheller in 1889
Tallest free-standing mountain in the world
Does not require technical climbing skills for most routes
Takes about five to nine days to climb
Featured in Ernest Hemingway's famous story
Wildlife including elephants live on lower slopes

profiles.name: Great Barrier Reef
clues: Composed of approximately 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands
Stretches over 2,300 kilometers along Queensland coast
Built by billions of tiny organisms called coral polyps over millions of years
Contains 400 types of coral and 1,500 species of fish
Visible from outer space, making it Earth's largest living structure
Located off the coast of Australia in the Coral Sea
Home to six species of sea turtles
Supports dugongs, also known as sea cows
Faces threats from climate change and coral bleaching
Generates billions in tourism revenue annually
Popular destination for scuba diving and snorkeling
Home to dolphins, whales, and sharks
One of the Seven Natural Wonders
Famous for its stunning underwater beauty
